frameDefinitions: A Speaker conventionally uses a particular Term to refer to an Entity.
A Cognizer has a piece of Content in their model of the world.

A Cognizer possesses knowledge about the workings, significance, or meaning of an idea or object, which we call Phenomenon, and is able to make predictions about the behavior or  occurrence of the Phenomenon.
A Cognizer holds a particular Opinion, which may be portrayed as being about a particular Topic.
A Cognizer has a Judgment of an Evaluee, expressing how high or low their regard for the Evaluee is.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
frameExamples: The pattern of conservation is similar to that found in C1_1, therefore we have <t>termed</t> this domain DC1 for divergent C1 domain.
Your boss is <t>aware</t> of your commitment.
I figured this out last week and now I really <t>understand</t> it.
John <t>thinks</t> that it looks better back .
What do you <t>think</t> of him as a linguist?
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
listRoleDefinitions: The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that is conventionally referred to by a <fen>Term</fen>.
The linguistic sign that is used for referring to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
The speaker or speech community that uses a <fen>Term</fen> to refer to a particular <fen>Entity</fen>.

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose awareness of phenomena is at question. With a target verb or adjective the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is generally expressed as an External Argument with the <fen>Content</fen> expressed as an Object or Complement.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s awareness. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a direct object or in a PP Complement.
Some verbs in this frame allow a <fen>Topic</fen> to be expressed in about-PPs.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part that reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state to the observer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is aware of the <fen>Content</fen>.
The sentient animate being who acquires new knowledge.
A state of affairs or dynamic system whose internal make-up and working the Cognizer comes to assimilate into their knowledge structure.
A part  of a person's cognitive-emotional faculties that is said to acquire knowledge.
This role indicates the when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> asssimilates the new knowledge.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose <fen>Opinion</fen> is in question.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s way of thinking, which is not necessarily generally accepted, and which is generally dependent on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s point of view.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the <fen>Opinion</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the one that makes a <fen>Judgment</fen>. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
<fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing that a judgment is made with respect to. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
A description (from the point of view of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>) of the position of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on a scale of approval.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Because of that shift, physicists call <fex>this effect</fex> the 'gravitational red shift.'
The French term this plant <fex>Petit Chêne</fex>, from the shape of the leaves.
<fex>Mathematicians</fex> call this subject 'arithmetic,' reserving the word 'algebra' for the more advanced aspects of the subject.
<fex>Your boss</fex> is aware of your commitment.
Your boss is aware <fex>of your commitment</fex>.
Kim knows <fex>about first aid</fex>.
Bob's <fex>eyes</fex> were overly aware

Yet there is no evidence that Mr. Parrish was cognizant <fex>at the time of the signing
of the notes</fex> that the clauses in issue were present.
<fex>Sue</fex> grasped the essentials right away
You must grasp <fex>the complex relationship of all these subjects to each other</fex>
<fex>My heart</fex> grasped that reality immediately.
<fex>Yesterday</fex> the students finally grasped the meaning of the equation
<fex>My</fex> take is that Johnson will not actually make it to the last round .

My take is <fex>that it is a version of the Macbeth story - what happens when people
become violent but cannot quite handle it</fex>.
<fex>The boss</fex> appreciates you for your diligence.
He regarded <fex>her</fex> poorly.
I hold him in the <fex>highest</fex> esteem.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Hot Snakes and Drive Like Jehu
